description:
Microbiology plays a central role in diverse areas of human life such as infectious disease, ecology, and biotechnology. This course will cover aspects of modern microbiology with an emphasis on prokaryotic organisms. The topics will include basic aspects of microbial diversity, genetics, and pathogenesis as well as examples of applied microbiology. 

Combined lecture and lab course. Lab fee $150.
name: MICROBIOLOGY

values.comments:
This course covers aspects of modern microbiology with an emphasis on prokaryotic organisms in particular. The topics include basic aspects of microbial diversity, genetics, and pathogenesis, as well as examples of applied microbiology. There are three hour-long midterm exams, with the third being given along with the final. The textbook used in this course was Biology of Microorganisms by Madigan, Martinko, Dunlap, and Clark (Prentice Hall), 12th edition.

The course follows a guest lecture format, which some students thought was “choppy” but others enjoyed. A general theme in students’ comments about the course was that they both thought it was interesting and learned a lot. As one student put it, “I liked how the course topics were very broad and how we were tested on lecture material in sections.”

Professor Pohlschroder’s lectures were interesting, but one student complained that the professor’s “slides were too full” with unimportant content.

The exams were lecture-based and detail-oriented, sometimes to the extent of “testing a minor detail,” which some students complained about. Overall, students did not feel that the difficulty of the exams was a major issue and thought that the course was an interesting and exciting introduction to microbiology.
